intro: Taraxacum turcicum, commonly known as Turkish dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of stiff, hairy leaves and a hollow, leafless stem that supports a single flower head. The flower head consists of both ray and disc florets, which are typically yellow in color. It produces a distinctive seed head composed of numerous lightweight, parachute-like seeds that are easily dispersed by the wind. This plant is native to regions of Turkey and the Middle East, and it is adapted to grow in a variety of soil types and environmental conditions.
